definitions: shortcoming or imperfection in a person or thing that causes it to fail or work improperly
act of abandoning one's country or cause in favor of an opposing one
examples: The product was recalled due to a manufacturing defect
Birth defects can sometimes be detected during pregnancy
His defect to the enemy shocked his former colleagues
The spy's defect revealed critical state secrets

definitions: desertion of one's country or cause in favor of an opposing one
examples: The general's defection weakened the rebel forces significantly
Political defections often occur before major elections

definitions: person who abandons their country or cause in favor of an opposing one
examples: The defector provided valuable intelligence to the government
Many defectors from the regime sought asylum abroad

definitions: action of defending from or resisting attack
case presented by or on behalf of the party being accused in a lawsuit
team's tactics for preventing the opposition from scoring
examples: The castle's defence withstood months of siege warfare
National defence requires significant military investment
The lawyer prepared a strong defence for her client
His defence relied on proving he was elsewhere
Their defence allowed only ten points in the game
The coach emphasized defence during practice sessions

definitions: humble submission and respect shown toward another person
examples: She showed great deference to her elderly grandmother
In deference to local customs, visitors removed their shoes

definitions: putting off of an action or event to a later time
examples: The deferral of payment helped the struggling business
College deferral allows students to take a gap year

definitions: open resistance or bold disobedience to authority or opposition
examples: Her defiance of the unjust law inspired many others
The teenager's defiance worried his concerned parents

definitions: device that gives electric shock to the heart to restore normal rhythm during cardiac arrest
examples: The paramedics used a defibrillator to save his life
Public buildings often have automated external defibrillators available

definitions: lack or shortage of something needed or required
examples: Vitamin D deficiency can cause bone problems
The report highlighted deficiencies in workplace safety

definitions: narrow gorge or passage between mountains
examples: The army marched through the mountain defile carefully
Snow blocked the defile preventing access to the valley

definitions: process of stating or describing exactly the nature or meaning of something
examples: The defining of terms clarified the contract significantly
His defining of success differed from conventional views

definitions: general decline in prices for goods and services in an economy
act of letting air or gas out of something
examples: Economic deflation can lead to reduced consumer spending
Japan experienced deflation for nearly two decades
The deflation of the balloon happened slowly overnight
Tire deflation can affect vehicle handling significantly

definitions: action or process of being turned aside from a straight course
examples: The deflection of the ball changed the game's outcome
Light deflection helps scientists study distant stars

definitions: device that changes the direction of something moving
examples: The wind deflector reduced noise in the convertible
Heat deflectors protect nearby surfaces from damage

definitions: clearing of forests or trees from land on a large scale
examples: Deforestation threatens many endangered species worldwide
Brazil has implemented policies to reduce Amazon deforestation

definitions: action or process of changing shape or distorting something
examples: Plastic deformation occurs when materials are stressed
The accident caused severe deformation of the car frame

definitions: deformed part of the body or thing that is misshapen
examples: The child's spinal deformity required corrective surgery
Birth deformities can sometimes be corrected with treatment

definitions: state of having lost physical, mental, or moral qualities considered normal and desirable
examples: Critics blamed social degeneracy for rising crime rates
The empire's degeneracy led to its eventual collapse

definitions: person whose behavior shows evidence of moral or physical deterioration
examples: Society often labels certain individuals as degenerates unfairly
The novel portrayed him as a degenerate gambler

definitions: process of declining from a higher to a lower level of functioning or quality
examples: Macular degeneration affects millions of elderly people
The degeneration of the building required immediate repairs

definitions: process of something being damaged or made worse in quality
treatment or regard of someone as worthless or beneath dignity
examples: Environmental degradation threatens future generations
Soil degradation reduces agricultural productivity significantly
The prisoners suffered degradation and abuse daily
She refused to accept such degradation at work

definitions: process of depriving a person or group of positive human qualities
examples: War often involves the dehumanization of enemies
The dehumanization of workers led to labor reforms

definitions: harmful reduction in the amount of water in the body
examples: Severe dehydration requires immediate medical attention
Athletes must guard against dehydration during competitions

definitions: act of making someone or something into a god or treating them as one
examples: The emperor's deification occurred after his death
Celebrity deification can have negative social effects

definitions: belief in the existence of a supreme being who created but doesn't intervene in the universe
examples: Many Enlightenment thinkers embraced deism over traditional religion
Deism influenced several American founding fathers' beliefs

definitions: god or goddess in a polytheistic religion
examples: Ancient Greeks worshipped many deities on Mount Olympus
Each deity had specific powers and responsibilities

definitions: person sent or authorized to represent others at a conference or meeting
examples: Each state sent delegates to the constitutional convention
The delegate spoke on behalf of her constituents

definitions: act of entrusting tasks or responsibilities to another person
examples: Effective delegating helps managers focus on priorities
His delegating of authority improved team productivity

definitions: group of delegates or representatives sent to speak for others
act of entrusting tasks or authority to another person
examples: The trade delegation met with foreign officials
A delegation from the company visited the factory
Proper delegation requires trust in team members
The delegation of responsibilities freed up her schedule

definitions: process of removing written or printed material
examples: The deletion of sensitive data protected customer privacy
Accidental file deletion caused significant work loss

definitions: shop selling cooked meats, cheeses, and prepared foods
examples: We bought fresh sandwiches from the corner deli
The deli offers imported cheeses from several countries

definitions: long and careful consideration or discussion of a matter
examples: After much deliberation, the jury reached a verdict
The committee's deliberation lasted several hours

definitions: choice or expensive food considered particularly desirable
quality of being very careful about what you do or say
examples: Caviar is considered a delicacy in many cultures
Local delicacies attracted tourists to the region
The situation requires delicacy and diplomatic skill
She handled the matter with great delicacy

definitions: shop selling prepared foods, foreign or unusual foods, and other specialties
examples: The delicatessen imported fine meats from Europe
We ordered party platters from the local delicatessen

definitions: feeling of great pleasure and happiness
person or thing that gives great pleasure
examples: Her face showed pure delight at the surprise
Children squealed with delight on Christmas morning
The garden was a delight to visitors
Her singing voice is an absolute delight

definitions: action of fixing the boundary or limits of something
examples: Border delimitation prevented future territorial disputes
The delimitation of responsibilities clarified everyone's role

definitions: action of describing or portraying something precisely
examples: The report's delineation of problems helped find solutions
Clear delineation of duties prevents workplace conflicts

definitions: minor crime or antisocial behavior, especially by young people
failure to pay an outstanding debt
examples: Juvenile delinquency rates decreased after the new programs
The study examined causes of teenage delinquency
Mortgage delinquency can lead to foreclosure proceedings
Credit card delinquency affects your credit score

definitions: young person who regularly commits minor crimes
person who fails to pay debts or fulfill obligations
examples: The program helps delinquents return to school
Juvenile delinquents often need guidance, not punishment
Tax delinquents received final warning notices
The bank contacted delinquents about overdue payments

definitions: acute disturbed state of mind with restlessness, illusions, and incoherence
examples: High fever can sometimes cause delirium in patients
The injured soldier experienced delirium from pain medication

definitions: act of being rescued or set free from danger or difficulty
examples: The villagers prayed for deliverance from the drought
Their deliverance came when rescue boats finally arrived

definitions: small valley, usually among trees
examples: We picnicked in a shady dell beside the stream
The cottage nestled in a dell surrounded by oaks

definitions: triangular area of land where a river divides before entering the sea
fourth letter of the Greek alphabet
examples: The Nile delta supports millions of Egyptian farmers
Rivers deposit sediment as they form deltas
Scientists use delta to represent change in equations
The delta symbol appears frequently in mathematics

definitions: thick triangular muscle covering the shoulder joint
examples: Weight training helps strengthen the deltoid muscle
The injection was administered in the deltoid

definitions: severe flood or very heavy fall of rain
overwhelming amount of things happening at the same time
examples: The deluge destroyed homes throughout the valley
Biblical stories describe a great deluge covering Earth
A deluge of complaints followed the policy change
She received a deluge of emails after the announcement

definitions: false belief or opinion about reality held despite evidence to the contrary
examples: He suffered from delusions about being followed
The delusion that money brings happiness persists

definitions: action of fixing the boundary or limits between two things
examples: Clear demarcation between work and personal life helps
The demarcation of territories prevented border disputes

definitions: outward behavior or bearing of a person
examples: His calm demeanor reassured the frightened children
Professional demeanor is important in business meetings

definitions: outward behavior or bearing of a person
examples: Her confident demeanour impressed the interview panel
The suspect's demeanour suggested he was hiding something

definitions: chronic disorder of mental processes caused by brain disease or injury marked by memory disorders and personality changes
examples: Alzheimer's disease is the most common cause of dementia
Early dementia symptoms include memory loss and confusion
